intro: Sebaea multinodis, commonly known as the nodding sebaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Sebaea multinodis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
